Name: Bruna Soares
Description:
Bruna was stabbed to death at around 4am on Friday 1st November.

> [deadname] Gomes Soares's 23-year-old family travelled to Linhares, in the north of Espírito Santo, to officially identify the body of the young stab victim at the Guriri spa in São Mateus and arrange for her transfer to the Valley. [deadname], who was transsexual and used the name Bruna Soares, died during the early hours of Friday (1st).
>
> As reported to the St. Matthew press, around 4 am Friday morning, the victim was found lying near a supermarket on Avenida Othovarino Duarte Santos. The military police provided assistance to her after she was injured.
>
> The PMs referred the victim to Roberto Silvares Hospital but she died from blood loss while receiving medical attention. Bruna was unable to describe who her attacker was or their motive.

Name: Paula Santos
Description:
Paula's body was found in a bag with hands and feet tied next to Jequié's Ring Road on Tuesday 5th November after she had been being missing for several days.

Because of the state of decomposition of her body fingerprint analysis was required to identify her. 

> The body found yesterday in a thicket on the banks of Jequié's Ring Road may be that of the [trans woman] [Paula] Santos Junior, who had been missing for several days. The body was found by the police in an advanced state of decomposition last Tuesday (05).
>
> This Wednesday (06), relatives of the victim went to the Jequié IML to recognise the body. However, due to the state of decomposition, a fingerprint test will be needed to confirm the identity of the victim.
>
> Paula, as the [trans woman] was known, [was a sex worker] and because of family conflicts, did not live with her family.
>
> Police said the body was found in a bag, with hands and feet tied with electrical wires. It had probably the body been dumped there [after she had been killed elsewhere].

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's decomposed body was found partly buried at midday on Saturday 9th November. She had been missing since being kidnapped on 3rd November.

> A trans person, who had been reported as kidnapped since last November 3, was found semi buried

> Jacona.-On a site in the municipality of Jacona, known as "Puerta de Llave", the lifeless body of a trans and semi-buried person was located by local authorities.
>
> According to the publication Informativo Zamora, reports indicate that the subject was kidnapped on November 3 and her body was found by elements of the Municipal Police and Michoacán at about 12:00 noon on Saturday after a citizen reported finding decomposed human remains near the South Libramiento.
>
> UEEC elements of the State Attorney General's Office transferred the remains of the [female] subject to the local Semefo to continue investigations and then release the body to their relatives.
>
> At the moment no details of those responsible for the killing have been reported, nor the reasons why she was deprived of her life. Investigations are still ongoing.

https://www.contramuro.com/localizan-cuerpo-sin-vida-de-hombre-vestido-de-mujer-en-jacona/

http://www.grupovox.mx/notsview.php?id=15343
Tweet:
The decomposed body of an unidentified #trans woman was found in Jacona, Michoacán (Mexico) on 9 Nov 2019.

She had been missing since being kidnapped on 3 Nov 2019. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was one of three people shot in an attack by armed assailants. Two died, including the victim. The other victim (also a woman) was reported to be in a serious condition.

> Tonight there was a new act of violence in the streets Julián Carrillo and tenth in the center of the city, where three people were victims of armed subjects, who attacked them with bullets.
>
> An ambulance arrived at the scene to provide first aid to the only survivor to transfer her to the hospital. Apparently the people who died are a woman and a [trans woman].
>
> Units of the municipal police arrived at the scene to gather evidence. The person who survived is reported to be in a serious condition.

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead within a homeless shelter on the morning of Monday 4th November. The cause of her death was not reported.

> A 43-year-old transsexual was found dead in a City Hall-accredited care unit maintained by the Adventist Development and Relief Agency (ADRA). The facility, located at Rua Oswaldo Cruz, Juiz de Fora Center, has capacity to receive 50 people daily and houses women, transsexuals and families in transit.
>
> According to the PM, the death was noticed around 6am this Monday (4), when caregivers went to wake the residents and found the victim lying on the floor. Samu was called and confirmed the death. The PM was also called in to record the fact, as well as the technical expertise of the Civil Police. According to the authorities, there were no apparent signs of violence in the body, which was referred to the Forensic Medical Institute (IML). The cause of death will be ascertained.

https://tribunademinas.com.br/noticias/cidade/04-11-2019/travesti-e-encontrada-morta-em-unidade-de-acolhimento.html

https://twitter.com/Ramonrebelheart/status/1191827889433563136
Tweet:
An unidentified #trans woman was found dead within a homeless shelter in Juiz de Fora, Minas Gerais (Brazil) on the morning of 4 Nov 2019.

She was 43. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Jade Camila Díaz
Description:
Jade's body was found in a bag weighed down with stones in the Rio Torola river on Saturday 9th November. She had been missing since 6th November. Jade was a community leader who lived in Lolotiquillo and was creating a transgender women's collective in San Francisco Gotera, the provincial capital of Morazán state. She had also worked on forced displacement and migration issues, which particularly affect the trans community. > Jade, a transgender woman who had been missing since Wednesday, was found murdered in the Torola River, in a section of the channel that passes between the municipalities of Osicala and Meanguera in the department of Morazán. > > Her body was seen in the river by residents who circulated around the place and gave notice to the National Civil Police (PNC) this Saturday morning. > > Her photograph had been disseminated through social networks this week in an attempt to gain clues to her whereabouts. Attorney General Raul Melara also shared the alert and said that the institution's teams were active in the search. > > “DISAPPEARED - Jade Camila Díaz, was last seen on November 6 at 6:00 pm when she left her house dressed in blue shorts and a white tank top. Any information, at 2564 5029 or on the COMCAVIS TRANS EL SALVADOR Fanpage”, was read in the image disseminated by the non-governmental organization that has represented trans women in the country for a little over a decade. > > On the morning of that Wednesday when Jade would be last seen alive, Attorney General Raul Melara spoke of "an approximate eight daily complaints" of disappearances in El Salvador and mentioned that in the first six days of November they had warned of 23 missing people. But he assured that a "considerable percentage are found alive." > > “Not all the disappeared end up in homicide, many of the disappeared are because they migrated to another country, especially to the United States, others appear in the day, others left with the boyfriend or girlfriend, escaped from home, left home, other elders have been found on the street, there are a variety of reasons why a person disappears, ” President Nayib Bukele also said in a message on the first day of November in which he highlighted the reduction in murders achieved in his administration and in He who tried to explain that the disappearance of a person in El Salvador is not synonymous with death, only in a part of the cases, such as Jade's. > > Several Twitter accounts of people involved in defending the rights of the LGBTI community (lesbians, gays, bisexuals, transsexuals and intersexuals) ensure that the body had signs of torture. The PNC has not confirmed the information. > > They did reveal that part of their body was inserted in a bag, within which there were stones. > > Jade, whose name according to the National Registry of Natural Persons (RNPN) is [deadname] Díaz, resided in the municipality of Lolotiquillo, near the location where she was found dead. > > Just two weeks ago, the LGBTI community had been beaten with the murder of another of its members on Los Heroes Boulevard in San Salvador. The crime transcended by the particularity with which it had been committed, because the victim, held from a vehicle, was dragged along the road to her death.

Jade Camila Díaz fue asesinada y lanzada a un río enel departamento de Morazán, El Salvador. Es la sexta mujer trans asesinada en el país que se niega a reconocer sus derechos. pic.twitter.com/m8IRBldPTq

— Paula Rosales (@rosalespaula) November 9, 2019
Jade Camila Diaz was the 47th trans person to be murdered in El Salvador without a single conviction since 2005 - despite the legislature passed a law [enhancing penalties for hate crimes based on sexual orientation and gender identity](https://www.washingtonblade.com/2015/09/09/el-salvador-lawmakers-approve-enhanced-hate-crime-penalties/) in that year. Name: Brighiit Mirón
Description:
Brighiit was shot in the head at around 11pm on 9th November. She and one of her friends had previously been threatened.

> Brighiit Mirón, a 15-year-old transgender teenager, was killed on November 9 with a bullet in the head in the Chipilapa neighborhood, in La Gomera, a municipality in the department of Escuintla in central-southern Guatemala, 47 kilometers from the city [of Escuintla].
>
> Brighiit had been last seen at a fair in the town center. At around eleven o'clock at night neighbors heard gunshots from behind the local church and alerted Volunteer Firefighters of the 60 company of La Gomera. Upon arrival, firefighters found her body lifeless. Brighiit was buried in the General Cemetery # 2 of La Gomera, Escuintla.
>
> A friend, who asked not to be identified, told Presentes that both had been threatened. As soon as they heard the news [of her death], they decided to flee the area for fear of meeting the same fate. Another person who met her told [Presentes] that Brighiit lived with her mother and five younger siblings. They added that she was a charismatic, kind, affectionate person, and although she was engaged in sex work her dream was to be a professional makeup artist.

https://planettransgender.com/brighiit-miron-15-year-old-trans-girl-executed-in-guatemala/

http://agenciapresentes.org/2019/11/25/guatemala-asesinaron-a-balazos-adolescente-trans/
Tweet:
Brighiit Mirón was shot in the head in La Gomera, Escuintla (Guatemala) on 9 Nov 2019.

She was 15. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Alejandra
Description:
Alejandra was kidnapped on Tuesday 3rd November. A week later her body was found on wasteland partially buried and in a state of decomposition.

> Jacona.-In a property of the municipality of Jacona, known as “Puerta de Llave”, the lifeless body of a transgender and semi-buried person was found by local authorities.
>
> According to a publication of Informativo Zamora, the reports indicate that the subject was deprived of his liberty since last November 3 but it was at the edge of 12:00 hours last Saturday that his body was found by elements of the Municipal Police and Michoacán, after the citizen complaint that near the South Libramiento human remains were found in a state of putrefaction.

TvT partner organisation: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans

https://www.contramuro.com/localizan-cuerpo-sin-vida-de-hombre-vestido-de-mujer-en-jacona/
Tweet:
Alejandra was kidnapped on 3 Nov 2020. A week later her decomposing body was found on wasteland in Jacona, Michoacán (Mexico).

She was 38. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Pedrita Alves da Silva
Description:
Pedrita's body was found in a hotel. There was bleeding from her nose and her body showed signs of mistreatment. The case was registered as a suspicious death.

> Ribeirão Preto Police Station (DIG) are seeking information about the circumstances surrounding the death of [deadname] Alves da Silva, 47, a [trans woman] known as Pedrita, found dead on Sunday afternoon (10), in a hotel on Rua Américo Brasiliense in the downtown area.
>
> The hotel owner told military police that the victim had been infected with HIV for 25 years, suffered from tuberculosis and was beaten a year ago, losing her sight.
>
> According to the hotel owner, an employee brought lunch to Pedrita in his room and, returned hours later at 4pm to find her lifeless.
>
> Pedrita was a drug user and it is suspected that she may have overdosed.
> 
> Vitória Régia, a representative of an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization), told police she suspects Pedrita was ill-treated and not being properly cared for, since her body was bleeding from her nose and that her death occurred early.
>
> The NGO representative, however, also stated that the victim had a history of narcotic use and therefore an alleged overdose could not be ruled out.
>
> The case was registered as a suspicious death and sudden death without determinant cause, at the CPJ (Central Judicial Police), in Ribeirão Center. 

https://xtudoribeirao.com.br/2019/11/11/travesti-e-encontrado-morto-em-hotel-na-regiao-da-baixada-em-rp/

https://www.tribunaribeirao.com.br/site/travesti-e-encontrada-morta-em-hotel-no-centro-de-ribeirao/

They were 47. #SayTheirName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Michelle
Description:
Michelle was shot inside a bar named "La Shula" by a group of armed assailants. Two other people were injured in the attack.

> Gunmen gunned down a group of people who were in a bar located near the Zihuatanejo Center, where a transgender woman died and two others were injured.
>
> As reported by the authorities, the victim was identified as Michelle "N", who was was indicated to be a member of the LGBTT community of Zihuatanejo.
>
> The aggression was reported to the authorities after five in the afternoon on Tuesday, in a bar named "La Shula", formerly "Ego´s" bar, located on the corner of Vicente Guerrero with Nicolás Bravo.
>
> After the attack, the lifeless body of a [woman] dressed as a woman was left lying on the corridor outside the establishment among the tables and chairs.
>
> During the assault, two other people were injured, and were taken to a hospital for medical attention.

Name: Gisela Corvalán ("Yiyila")
Description:
Gisela sustained multiple stab wounds in an attack at her home on Monday 19th August. She died in hospital on Wednesday 13th November.

> Those who entered the house of Gisela Corvalán, 47, did not steal anything but still stabbed her many more times than necessary to kill. Gisela lived alone in Los Miranda, a town of 100 inhabitants north of the capital of Santiago del Estero. On August 19, after being stabbed 9 times, she somehow survived spending 12 hours bleeding and alone. The months that followed were spent between coma and intensive therapy, receiving transfusions difficult to obtain because her blood group is uncommon (rhesus negative). Last night [13th November] she died.
>
> This Saturday the march of pride that will be held in Santiago del Estero will have as its main slogan "Justice for Gisela".

Daniel Clemente Romano was arrested in connection with her murder.

> “The information we have is that the defendant is being held at a Termas de Río Hondo police station and that he has already had a record because of conflicts with other people. He apparently was with one or two other people whose stories contradict each other and the only thing that was stolen was her ID. They took it to support their story that they had gone their to rob her it but in reality they were with the intention of killing her. That indicates that it was an attack of hate, ” Luisa Lucía Paz, president of ATTTA (Association of Transvestites, Transsexuals and Transgenders of Argentina) told Red Harvest .
>
> Gisela was nicknamed Yiyila and was part of a family who respected her trans identity. She dedicated herself to taking care of sick people and her relatives remember her as a rather introverted person, who had no dramas with the neighbors or environment. Although she was not an activist, she used to participate in training and care talks aimed at the T community.

https://www.nuevodiarioweb.com.ar/noticias/2022/10/02/361078-rechazan-cese-de-prision-a-sujeto-que-apunalo-a-un-trans-y-causo-su-muerte

Gisela Corvalán ("Yiyila") was stabbed in her home in Los Miranda, a small town north of Santiago del Estero (Argentina) on 19 Aug 2019. She died in hospital in Santiago del Estero on 13 Nov 2019.

She was 47. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Mónica Rivera ("Mónica de la Torre")
Description:
Mónica's decomposing body was found in a container filled with concrete on Friday 15th November. She owned a bar named La Doña and had been missing since Wednesday 6th November.

> This Saturday afternoon, according to unofficial accounts, the remains located on the afternoon of this Friday were identified near the area known as Puente del Muerto ["the Bridge of the Dead"], next to the El Diamante-Balsas de Agua state highway, in Martínez de la Torre.
>
> The body belongs to someone who was known as "La Mónica de la Torre", whose real name was [deadname] Rivera, homosexual owner of La Doña Bar and who had been reported missing for several days. 
>
> “Monica de la Torre” was reported missing since last November 6, when around 11:00 a.m. that day she left her home aboard her Ford Ecosport van With license plates YGE2541 from the state of Veracruz. From that moment until this Friday there was no information of her whereabouts. 
>
> On Friday a corpse in an advanced state of decomposition was located inside a container apparently filled with concrete, near the site known as El Puente del Muerto, on the El Diamante-Balsas highway in the municipality.

https://www.notinfomex.mx/2019/11/era-la-monica-de-la-torre-transexual-el.html

Mónica Rivera's body was found in entombed in concrete in Martínez de la Torre, Veracruz (Mexico) on 15 Nov 2019.

She was a bar owner who had been missing since 6 Nov 2019. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Jerrika Rivas Ruíz
Description:
Jerrika was reportedly killed during after a fight with another trans woman.

She was originally from Palmira in Valle de Cauca but had been living in Bogotá for at least 5 years.

> In Palmira they were finally able to locate Jerrika's family, the Afro trans woman who was murdered in Bogotá and who had not been fully identified from the documents she was carrying. She met her death at 3am this Saturday in [Bogotá].
>
> Jerrika, [deadname] Rivas Ruiz first name, was 28 years old and had been living in Bogotá for at least five years.
>
> In the project **Todos Somos Buenos**, she herself talking about having fallen into drug use and becoming a street dweller.
>
> She recovered for a while, but TuBarco was able to learn that she was living on the streets again. She could not completely get away from alcohol, and not having been able to get a stable job complicated her intention to get ahead.
>
> The Subdirectorate for LGBTI Affairs of the Mayor's Office of Bogotá confirmed to this website that Jerrika died in the middle of a fight "with another trans woman" the center of the town of Los Mártires. The murderer has fled and is being searched for by the police.
>
> Jerrika had left Palmira as she wanted to work in a place without being pointed at. She arrived in Cali where she lived for a while but while in this city began to use hallucinogenic substances. When she arrived in Bogotá, she had friends who wanted to help her. They helped her stay in touch with her family in Valle del Cauca, but she did not want to return to her homeland.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IhyBrDCLfN8" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Note that some reports name Jerrika as "Yerrika".

https://www.facebook.com/NuestraaRegion/posts/2570005999720939

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IhyBrDCLfN8

Jerrika Rivas Ruíz was murdered in Los Mártires, Bogotá (Colombia) on 16 Nov 2019.

She was 28. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Victoria Pineda
Description:
Victoria's naked body was found lying in the street with her arms open in a "crucifixion" pose . Her face had been disfigured by blows.

She was an activist and community leader.

> San Salvador, - Hate crimes against the LGTBI community (lesbians, gays, after, bi and intersex) are civilized by the government and the media in El Salvador, where another 'trans' woman was recently murdered with barbarism.
>
> Victoria's body, whose legal name was [possible deadname] Pineda, dawned lifeless and with signs of torture and vexation in the middle of the street, in what qualifies as a hate crime for her gender identity.
>
> Neither the Attorney General's Office for the Defense of Human Rights, nor the Attorney General's Office nor President Nayib Bukele have yet ruled on this murder, perpetrated in a town in Ahuachapán (west).
>
> The Minister of Culture, Suecy Callejas, referred to the crime by condemning on Twitter 'social violence, especially that which attacks the most vulnerable populations', a message criticized as being lazy and generalizing.
>
> 'Dear Sue, let's start by pointing things out by name: they are hate crimes against the LGBTI population. The situation deserves forcefulness in the speech and in the actions', replied the activist Erick Ortiz.

TvT partner organisation: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans

http://agenciapresentes.org/2019/11/19/asesinaron-a-otra-trans-en-el-salvador-3-transfemicidios-en-menos-de-un-mes/

https://elmundo.sv/pddh-persona-lgtbi-asesinada-en-ahuachapan-sin-identificar-48-horas-despues-del-crimen/

https://www.elsalvador.com/noticias/nacional/indignacion-por-otro-brutal-asesinato-de-una-persona-de-la-comunidad-lgtbi/660202/2019/

Victoria Pineda's naked body was found lying in the street in San Francisco Menéndez, Ahuachapán (El Salvador) on 16 Nov 2019.

She was 44. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Uber Agudelo Meléndez ("La Popis")
Description:
Uber was stabbed by an unidentified assailant - reportedly after bricks had been thrown at her. She died after being taken to hospital.

> Uber Agudelo died in in Restrepo Valle after receiving severe blows and wounds to the body. She was 41 years old and recognized in the municipality as "La Popis". Her grieving sister Juliana said she was a cheerful person who made people laugh, although she could be a bit intense sometimes when she got drunk.
>
> So far they do not know how the homicide occurred and they hope that the police will soon determine that. Her funeral will possibly be Tuesday or Wednesday after Buga Legal Medicine releases her body.
>
> Meanwhile the authorities have begun an investigation to locate the murderer, said Colonel Óscar Cárdenas Comandante (E) of the Valle Police. Apparently La Popis was attacked in a fight with a sharp weapon. She died after being transferred to the San José hospital in the municipality.

Name: Pedrita dos Santos Silva
Description:
Pedrita was shot in the head.

> Alagoas records another crime against the LGBT community. A 20-year-old girl who identified herself as Pedrita was murdered with several shots to the head in the early hours of Monday (18). The murder took place at Residencial Hélio Jatobá II, in São Miguel dos Campos.
>
> According to her mother the victim was a drug addict and was reportedly arrested for attempted murder. Unofficial intelligence reports that the victim had allegedly stolen a cell phone and was trying to exchange it for drugs when she was murdered. Pedrita has the official identity of [deadname] dos Santos Silva.

https://www.alagoas24horas.com.br/1258019/travesti-e-assassinada-com-tiros-na-cabeca-no-interior-de-al/

Pedrita dos Santos Silva was shot in São Miguel dos Campos, Alagoas (Brazil) on 18 Nov 2019.

She was 20. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Sarita Sudario da Silva
Description:
Sarita's naked body was found with 15 stab wounds in her home. Two used condoms were found next to her body.

> The 40-year-old [trans woman] [deadname] Sudario da Silva, known as "Sarita", was found dead on Monday afternoon (18) at her home, located at Rua Vila Nova, Cidade de Deus neighborhood, north of Manaus. Sarita's body was lying on the floor with several knife wounds. According to expert reports, condoms were used near the body, which was stripped naked and was nearly cut off by the perpetrator.
>
> Neighbors said the victim had lived in her home for about six years, was well-liked in the community and had no involvement with illicit activities. She was a native of Itaituba, in the interior of the state of Pará, lived alone and had no relatives in Manaus. The case is still under investigation by the Specialized Homicide and Kidnapping Police Station (DEHS).

None of the reports found stated that Sarita was trans, but this was conirmed by ANTRA Brasil.

https://www.oarautodadiversidade.com/2019/11/com-aproximadamente-15-facadas.html

https://amazonas1.com.br/policia/amigos-encontram-corpo-de-homem-com-ferimento-de-faca-no-pescoco/

https://www.portalmarcossantos.com.br/2019/11/18/homem-e-encontrado-morto-a-facadas-em-apartamento/

https://d24am.com/amazonas/policia/homem-e-assassinado-a-facadas-dentro-da-propria-casa-no-bairro-cidade-de-deus/

https://d.emtempo.com.br/policia/178992/preservativos-usados-estavam-ao-lado-de-homem-morto-com-15-facadas

Sarita Sudario da Silva's body was found with multiple stab wounds in her home in Manaus,  Amazonas (Brazil) on 18 Nov 2019.

She was 40. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Carol
Description:
Carol was reportedly stabbed by her boyfriend.

> 01 – Carol – Transexual – Facadas – Residência – São Gonçalo do Amarante – RN
>
> 06/12/2019
>
> Carol was murdered by her boyfriend.
>
> Atransparência – RN.

Note that Rede Trans Brasil report that she died in São Gonçalo do Amarante (which is adjacent to Extremoz) on 6th December; ANTRA report that she was killed in Extremoz on 21st November.

Name: Coral
Description:
Coral's body was found dumped and wrapped in a blanket the morning after the International Trans Day of Remembrance. She had been tortured and shot twice in the head.

> MEXICO CITY.- The lifeless body of a transsexual person was found wrapped in blankets, with signs of torture and two shots in the head next to the building of the Command Center of the Federal Police, in the mayor's office of Iztapalapa. 
>
> The finding occurred around 7:20 a.m. on Thursday on Telecommunications Avenue, El Graph reported. 
>
> According to the media, the body was found by an employee at the site who noticed that there was a purple lump with traces of blood on the sidewalk. The man immediately notified his co-workers who guarded the site. 
>
> The body, which wore women's clothing, was tied with ankles, hands and neck with ropes and transparent tape and had two bullet impacts on the head. 
>
> The victim was identified by the [social name] "Coral" and was a member of the LGBTTTI community. 

https://www.elgrafico.mx/la-roja/torturan-transexual-y-encuentran-su-cadaver-con-dos-balazos-en-iztapalapa

Name: Rafaela de Salles
Description:
Rafaela was run over by a truck. Reportedly she was holding onto the door of the vehicle and arguing with the driver at the time.

> A [trans woman] identified as Rafaela died on the morning of Friday (22) after being hit by a truck in downtown Linhares-ES.
>
> According to the initial information, the [trans woman] had been arguing with the truck driver and at some point had hung on the door of the vehicle.
>
> It was at this moment that she suffered a fall and was hit by the vehicle itself. According to information, the transvestite was operating in the vicinity of a gas station, on the banks of BR 101, near the Joaquim Calmon bridge.
>
> Emergency fire brigade professionals were called in and sent the transvestite to the Linhares General Hospital (HGL), but she could not resist the injuries and died. The Military Police were also triggered by residents of the region.

https://www.folhadoes.com/noticia/policia-espirito-santo/57422/travesti-morre-atropelada-caminhao-apos-briga-com-motorista-no-es

Name: Isabely Prado
Description:
Isabely's body was found by her father on Saturday 23rd November. She had been missing since Thursday 14th November.

> Tramandaí - The body of young transgender Isabely Prado, 23, was found by her father on the morning of Saturday, the 23rd, covered by branches amid the scrub on Avenida Perimetral. According to the Military Brigade, the emergency services were called by family members at 8 o'clock and the body was already in an advanced state of decomposition.
>
> Isabely was a social name of [deadname] Rodrigues da Silveira and who had been missing for nine days. The Civil Police are already working to find out the authorship and motivation of the crime.

In January 2020 two people were arrested:

> According to police chief Paulo Perez, head of the Tramandaí police station, the 36-year-old man was arrested in Gravataí, in Mato Alto, where he fled before [Isabely's] body was even found. Another 35-year-old suspected of involvement in the crime was arrested Monday (13) in Tramandaí. The case is being treated as murder, robbery followed by death.

Isabely's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/isabelly.prado.52438/.

https://g1.globo.com/rs/rio-grande-do-sul/noticia/2020/01/14/presos-por-morte-de-transexual-em-tramandai-vao-passar-por-acareacao-diz-policia.ghtml

Name: Monica Coelho
Description:
Monica was shot by a man in a vehicle who approached them in a vehicle while they were working. They ran screaming for help but collapsed nearby and died in hospital.

> [Possible deadname] Coelho de Almeida, 44, died this morning on Tuesday, 26, after being shot at Avenida Antônio Quintino Gomes, near a tire store in the Bodan ese neighborhood, in Vilhena.
>
> According to the police report, [possible deadname], who is a [trans person] known as Monica, was at her place of work on a street next to a tire store, when a man approached in a car appearing to be a white Fiat Fiorino. When she approached the car, the man fired, hitting her in the chest.
>
> She ran screaming for help, and fell into the tire yard.
>
> The Fire Department was called by witnesses and took the victim to the Regional Hospital. In the emergency room, she suffered cardiac arrest, but was resuscitated and taken to the operating room, where she succombed to her injuries and died. The Civil Police are investigating the case.

Monica's Facebook profiles are https://www.facebook.com/wesley.coelhodealmeida.3 and https://www.facebook.com/wesley.coelhodealmeida.5. Note that gender neutral pronouns are used in this report as the information available does not confirm that Monica had a binary female gender identity.

TvT partner organisation: IBTE

Name: Mufa Álava
Description:
Mufa was stabbed around 20 times in her home in the Quitumbe neighborhood. Her body was found by her housemate.

> The X Silhouette Association, through the Trans Psycho Center and members of the Ecuadorian Federation of LGBTI Organizations, makes this new fact publicly known to the LGBT community.
>
> Mufa Álava (Legal name: A. Álava), was 30 years old and from from San Vicente, Manabí. She lived in Quito, south in Quitumbe, in the Cdla. Ibarra, along with her friend Tyra Yanyn, who had given her an inn since October following the national strike in Ecuador.
>
> Her friend, Tyra, affirms to the Trans Psycho Center of Quito of the Silhouette X Association, that on Friday, November 29 she went to work in a hairdressing salon as she frequently did and that Mufa stayed in her room. Later Mufa called her because her lunch had run out. When Tyra returned at night, she discovered that her companion Mufa Álava had been murdered and wrapped in a quilt stained with blood, with (according to a preliminary investigation) about 20 stab wounds.
>
> Mufa Álava received a Christian burial this Sunday, December 1, 2019.
>
> We ask the authorities such as the National Police, Prosecutor's Office and the Judiciary Council to carry out the necessary investigations on this case, arrest the fugitives of this terrible murder and put them under the orders of justice.
>
> With the present, from the Runa Sipiy Observatory of Murders and violent deaths of the Silhouette X Association, there are fifteen murders or deaths suspected of criminality in this 2019, of which three are aimed at gay men and twelve at trans women.
>
> NI UNA TRANS MENOS, VIVAS NOS QUEREMOS!

Mufa's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/mufa.alava.

https://centropsicotrans.org/2019/12/02/asesinan-de-20-punaladas-a-mujer-trans-en-quitumbe/

https://siluetax.org/2019/12/02/asesinan-de-20-punaladas-a-mujer-trans-en-quitumbe/

https://siluetax.org/2019/12/02/asesinan-de-20-punaladas-a-mujer-trans-en-quitumbe/#jp-carousel-16035

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=2508970752489263&type=1&theater

https://www.facebook.com/FabicoAries38/videos/10156531338607056/
Tweet:
Mufa Álava was stabbed multiple times in her home in Quito (Ecuador) on 29 Nov 2019.

She was 30. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Rosa Granados
Description:
Rosa was shot in her home in Loma Larga. She was an activist who sold beauty products and carried out community work with the Estrella del Golfo organisation.

> The murder of Rosa Granados, a 28-year-old trans activist, has again raised alarms in El Salvador. In one month and three days four crimes were reported against the trans population. 
>
> According to police sources, Rosa was killed in her house with four shots in her head. She lived in the Loma Larga canton in the department of La Unión, 182 kilometers east of San Salvador.
>
> Rosa was part of the Estrella del Golfo organization and carried out community work on the promotion of the rights of LGBTI people in the east of the country. She also sold beauty products from a catalog in the neighboring cantons of Loma Larga. According to sources consulted by Presentes, one hypothesis is that she was the victim of extortion by gangs that demanded the delivery of money from the sales she made.
>
> Some time ago, Rosa tried to file a complaint with the attorney general's office, but gave up because of how difficult that process can be in El Salvador.
